Posts.Title: Alcohol

Posts.Content: Hi Flowers Just a brief message as I really should be going to bed!  Please, don't let it "Surround and suffocate" you.  Cancer is a monster but it can, and will be killed.  Think positive thoughts - thousands and thousands of women have been through what you have and have come out smiling on the other side. Yes, the treatment is unpleasant but plan treats for yourself to look forward to.  Have a girly night in with a bottle of wine, enjoy a bracing walk with your partner - whatever you enjoy doing.   If it has spread to your nodes it is not a huge deal.  They just whip 'em out!  As someone else says, it simply helps the medics plan the most effective treatment for you. Blow away that fog! xx
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed on 28th October, started Tamoxifen end of Nov and had a Sentinal Node Biopsy yesterday.  I know it is frustrating but the MRI etc are diagnostic tests and it is best they know exactly what and where your cancer is before they start cutting you up.  I've not heard of the 3 week guideline but do speak to your Breast Care Nurse and they can put your mind at rest. Take care. xx
Posts.Title: Still no surgery (invasive lobular grade 2)

Posts.Content: I only have one chemo left (hurrah!) and have noticed that so far this year, I have not had hayfever!  Maybe chemo has it's benefits after all.  Anyone else found this? xx
